      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class EntityImpl

      • lockHost

        public void lockHost(Host host)
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        The power manager keeps a lock counter for each host, this method increments the lock counter which is associated with the given host.

        As long as the counter is not null, calling PowerManager.canPowerOn(Host) or PowerManager.canPowerOff(Host) will return false.

        Specified by:
        lockHost in interface PowerManager
        See Also:
        PowerManager.unlockHost(Host)

      • unlockHost

        public void unlockHost(Host host)
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        The power manager keeps a lock counter for each host, this method decrements the lock counter which is associated with the given host.

        As long as the counter is not null, calling PowerManager.canPowerOn(Host) or PowerManager.canPowerOff(Host) will return false.

        Specified by:
        unlockHost in interface PowerManager
        See Also:
        PowerManager.lockHost(Host)

      • canPowerOn

        public boolean canPowerOn(Host host)
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        Returns true if the given host is not powered on and this entity authorizes to power on the given host.
        Specified by:
        canPowerOn in interface PowerManager
        Returns:
        true if and the given host is not powered on and this entity authorizes to power on the given host
        See Also:
        PowerManager.lockHost(Host), PowerManager.unlockHost(Host)

      • canPowerOff

        public boolean canPowerOff(Host host)
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        Returns true if the given host is not powered off and this entity authorizes to power off the given host.
        Specified by:
        canPowerOff in interface PowerManager
        Returns:
        true if the given host is not powered off and this entity authorizes to power off the given host This is usually true only if the host is not in use
        See Also:
        PowerManager.lockHost(Host), PowerManager.unlockHost(Host)

      • powerOn

        public void powerOn(Host host)
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        Powers on the given host.

        You should listen to appropriate notification code (CoreNotificationCodes.POWER_STATE_CHANGED) to know when the host is powered on as this may take time.

        Specified by:
        powerOn in interface PowerManager
        See Also:
        PowerManager.canPowerOn(Host)

      • powerOff

        public void powerOff(Host host)
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        Powers off the given host.

        You should listen to appropriate notification code (CoreNotificationCodes.POWER_STATE_CHANGED) to know when the host is powered off as this may take time.

        Specified by:
        powerOff in interface PowerManager
        See Also:
        PowerManager.canPowerOff(Host)

      • getPoweredOnHosts

        public List<Host> getPoweredOnHosts()
        Description copied from interface: PowerManager
        Returns a list of hosts that are powered on. This list includes only hosts that were powered on using current PowerManager.
        Specified by:
        getPoweredOnHosts in interface PowerManager
        Returns:
        a list of hosts that are powered on
